org.zeromq

Class Sockets

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zeromq.Sockets

  • public class Sockets
extends Object
    Class containing utility methods for creating ØMQ Sockets and other related objects without using a ØMQ Context directly.

    • Method Summary

      Create a ØMQ proxy and start it up on another thread that exits when the context is closed.

        channels - One or more channels that can be multiplexed with ØMQ Sockets

      • newReactor

        public static Reactor newReactor(LoopHandler handler,
                                 long interval,
                                 TimeUnit unit)
        Create a ØMQ Reactor with a single LoopHandler which initially handles a repeating timer with the given interval.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler for executing event-driven polling of Sockets
        interval - The initial and subsequet delay for a repeating timer event
        unit - The time unit for the timer interval
        Returns:
        A new ØMQ Reactor

                                 List<Socket> sockets,
                                 List<SelectableChannel> channels)

        Parameters:

        sockets - One or more ØMQ Sockets
        channels - One or more channels that can be multiplexed with ØMQ Sockets
        Returns:
        A new ØMQ Poller

      • start

        public static void start(DeviceType deviceType,
                         String frontendUrl,
                         String backendUrl)
        Start a ØMQ Device of the given type, which will run in the background to bridge two networks together.
        Parameters:
        deviceType - The device type, specifying the pattern to use
        frontendUrl - The front-end socket which will be proxied to/from the back-end
        backendUrl - The back-end socket which will be proxied to/from the front-end

      • proxy

        public static void proxy(Socket frontEnd,
                         Socket backEnd)
        Create a ØMQ proxy and start it up. Returns when the context is closed.
        Parameters:
        frontEnd - The front-end socket which will be proxied to/from the back-end
        backEnd - The back-end socket which will be proxied to/from the front-end

      • forward

        public static void forward(Socket frontEnd,
                           Socket backEnd)
        Create a ØMQ proxy and start it up on another thread that exits when the context is closed.
        Parameters:
        frontEnd - The front-end socket which will be proxied to/from the back-end
        backEnd - The back-end socket which will be proxied to/from the front-end

      • fork

        public static Socket fork(Backgroundable backgroundable)
        Run a background thread with an inproc PAIR socket for communication.
        Parameters:
        backgroundable - The task to be performed on the background thread
        Returns:
        The inproc PAIR socket for communicating with the background thread
